title: sdformat-sdf 3.x package does not work well with libsdformat2

content.raw:
I made a quick test modifying our sdformat-sdf_3.0.7 prerelease version to use the stable names and use it to upgrade sdformat-sdf 2.3.2. 

To test:
```
sudo apt-get install gazebo5
wget https://www.dropbox.com/s/9w10damxre59c5g/sdformat-sdf_3.0.7-1~vivid_all.deb?dl=0
sudo dpkg -i sdformat-sdf.*
gazebo --verbose
```
Result:
```
jrivero@nium ~ $ gazebo --verbose
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 5.1.0
Copyright (C) 2012-2015 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 5.1.0
Copyright (C) 2012-2015 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.100
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.100
Error [Param.cc:102] Unknown parameter type[uint64_t]
Error [Param.cc:102] Unknown parameter type[uint64_t]
Error [Param.cc:102] Unknown parameter type[uint64_t]
Error [Param.cc:102] Unknown parameter type[uint64_t]
Error [Param.cc:102] Unknown parameter type[uint64_t]
Error [Param.cc:102] Unknown parameter type[uint64_t]
Error [Param.cc:102] Unknown parameter type[uint64_t]
Error [Param.cc:102] Unknown parameter type[uint64_t]
...
```
content.html:
I made a quick test modifying our sdformat-sdf_3.0.7 prerelease version to use the stable names and use it to upgrade sdformat-sdf 2.3.2.

To test:

sudo apt-get install gazebo5
wget https://www.dropbox.com/s/9w10damxre59c5g/sdformat-sdf_3.0.7-1~vivid_all.deb?dl=0
sudo dpkg -i sdformat-sdf.*
gazebo --verbose
